intro: Rosa × submitis, commonly known as the everblooming rose, is a hybrid shrub that combines traits from various rose species. It is characterized by its dense, thornless growth habit and its ability to produce flowers continuously throughout the growing season. The plant typically has dark green, glossy leaves and produces fragrant, semi-double to fully double flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. Rosa × submitis is well-suited for container gardening and can thrive in a variety of soil types with adequate sunlight. Its botanical resilience and ornamental value make it a popular choice for both gardens and floral arrangements.
